resources.string: With your buds in and on, stream any song you like from your music player of choice. Then return to this screen.
As you become more or less relaxed, your changing brain dynamics will adjust the treble and bass on the track. You should be able to hear these changes and see them reflected below.
To boost alpha (bass), close your eyes and try to clear your mind. To boost beta (treble) open your eyes again.
If nothing changes or you see "No Signal" refer to the Fit Guide.
Get ready for better sleep and brighter days
Budz brain-sensing technology can detect when you fall asleep and identify your current sleep stage. They use this information to provide sleep-enhancing audio.
To get started, select a "fall asleep" sound from our library. Or, if you prefer, simply pop in your Budz and stream your favorite audio.
Once Budz detect that you’re asleep, the audio will gently switch to your designated “stay asleep” track.
If you opt into “Restoration Boost,” Budz will play slow-wave enhancing audio during the deepest stages of sleep.

NextSense is committed to good data privacy practices. We think you have the right to understand how we collect and use your data. Here are the basics:

%1$ Budz collect neural data through EEG sensors to enhance your sleep and overall brain health. This data helps us personalize audio features, improve your sleep quality, and identify trends over time.

%2$ We use your data to provide personalized insights and improve product functionality. We analyze the patterns to offer better sleep solutions and make real-time adjustments to the audio you hear.

We %3$ upload your data to the cloud or sell it to third parties.

Open Bluetooth: Open the Bluetooth screen from your notification bar.

Select Bluetooth: Make sure "Use Bluetooth" is selected.

Pair Budz: Press "Pair new device" and select "Budz" from the list.

Confirm Connection: Once connected, you'll see "Budz" under "Bluetooth"

If you encounter any issues, ensure your Budz are charged and within range of your device.
